responses: Hello my name is Juan, what can I do for you?
Hello, how can I assist you?
Hi, I am Juan La Salle. The only Juan you need. How can I be of assistance?
Hello, is there anything I can help you with?
Good day. I am your Digital Assistant, Juan. How can I help.

Hi I am Juan, short for Just a University Assistant powered by a Neural Network. I am a brain child of David Yabis, Isobelle Casado, and James Rafols from BCS32. I am a chatbot made to answer your questions :)))).
General Kenobi ;)

patterns: Why is there a need to pre-register
Why do I need to pre-register
Why is there a need to pre register
Why do I need to pre register
Do I need to pre register?
responses: Pre-registration gives the students an easier and faster enrollment process. Classes are reserved for them.

patterns: Why do I need to reserve slots
responses: During enrollment, each class reaches the maximum number of students. The schedule you desire may be full by the time you enroll if you do not pre-register.
A regular student is one who is enrolled in the total number of units prescribed in the curriculum.

patterns: When can I shift to another course
Will I be able to shift?
What do I need to shift?
responses: Freshmen are allowed to shift by the end of the First Semester. Upperclassmen may shift at the end of the current semester when grades become available. You may reach out to the registrar's office for detailed list of requirements.

patterns: If I have a question about my curriculum or grades, where do I go?
Where will I ask about my grades?
Where can I see my grades?
If I have a question about my curriculum or grades, where do I go?
responses: You may address your questions to the office of the registrar or check your grades on your portal.
See you later, thanks for visiting
Have a nice day
Bye! Come back again soon.
Happy to help!
Any time!
My pleasure

patterns: Why is there a need to pre-register?
responses: Pre-registration gives the students an easier and faster enrollment process. Classes are reserved for them.

patterns: Why do I need to reserve slots?
responses: During enrollment, each class reaches the maximum number of students. The schedule you desire may be full by the time you enroll if you do not pre-register.
A regular student is one who is enrolled in the total number of units prescribed in the curriculum.

patterns: When can I shift to another course?
responses: Freshmen are allowed to shift by the end of the First Semester. Upperclassmen may shift at the end of the current semester when grades become available.

patterns: One of my pre-registered subjects is gone, what happened to it?
responses: You might have failed the pre-requisite subject you have taken the previous semester or the faculty has not submitted your grade yet. Check your flowchart.

patterns: I have already logged in on OnE, but I am unable to access the online registration, what do I do?
responses: These holds prevent you from enrolling in courses or viewing your grades but not from logging in. There are several reasons for your holds -- each with a different way or office to address or clear it. You must resolve your hold with the office that initiated it. For example, if you have a balance from your tuition and other fees, you will need to pay it and clear your account from the Student Accounts Section to have this hold removed.

patterns: My COR says I'm an 'APM11' student, what does it mean?
What is the meaning of APM11
responses: APM11 is your program code and section code. APM is the program code (progcode) for BS Applied Mathematics and 11 is the section code (sectcode) for freshmen, section 1. All programs in the University have assigned progcodes.

patterns: I'm currently listed as a sophomore, but I should be listed as a junior, how do I change my class standing?
How can i change my class standing?
How do I fix my class standing?
responses: You have to go to the Records EvaluaTranscript of Records in charge of your program. For example, if you are a junior BS Biology student, go to the Office of the Registrar. Your records will be reviewed before changes are made.

patterns: I currently belong to HUB21 but I would like to transfer to HUB22, how do I go about it?
responses: Submit a letter of request to change the section to the department where your program belongs. For example, if you are a BS Biology student, go to the Biological Sciences Department.

patterns: How can I confirm that I am officially enrolled in courses?
How can I verify my enrollment?
How do I know if I am enrolled?
responses: You will be able to print your COR and your name will appear on your professor's class list.

patterns: My online registration shows Transaction 2, what is it?
responses: Transaction 2 is an updated version of your COR. This means you changed or added one or more subjects from your first transaction. Every change of registration means additional transactions.

patterns: Is there a limit to online enrollment transactions?
How many online enrollment transactions can I have?
What is the limit of online enrollmet?
What is the maximum number of online enrollment transactions?
How many times can I enroll online?
responses: Yes, the maximum is 3. However, on a case to case basis, a fourth transaction may be allowed. You need to pay a specific amount before you could proceed to Transaction 4.

patterns: Why is it that I can view the subjects in OnE, but, I can not add it to my registration?
Can't add a subject to registration
responses: Most of the time, the reason is that a particular subject is exclusive for other programs.

patterns: For example, I want to enroll in ENGL102, but, I can't search it. Why is it so?
Can't find a specific program and section
Can't find a program and section
responses: There are two possible reasons: it's either that specific subject is not offered for enrollment or you did not pass its pre-requisite subject. Some subjects have pre-requisites. Students must pass these subjects before enrolling.

patterns: How can I update my name?
responses: For name correction or change, submit a copy of the PSA-certified birth certificate and supporting document to the Records Section (Counter 2). Proceed to the ID Section (Counter 7).

patterns: Do I have to apply for graduation?
How can I apply for graduation?
Where do I apply for gradution
responses: Yes. You can get the application for graduation form from the Records EvaluaTranscript of Records assigned to your program.

patterns: How much is the graduation fee?
How much do I have to pay for graduation
responses: Yes. Verify the amount at the Student Accounts Section.

patterns: Do I still have to pay the graduation fee if I will not attend the commencement ceremonies?
I did not attend the commencement ceremonies. Do I still have to pay the graduation fee?
Did not attend commence ceremonies. Do I still have to pay?
Do I still have to pay my grad fee even if I did not attend
responses: Yes. You still have to pay for the graduation fee.

patterns: When will I know if I am graduating with academic honors?
Am I graduating as an honor student?
responses: You will be notified a week before the graduation date by the Office of the Registrar.

patterns: Do I need entry cards and/or invitations for the Graduation Rites
responses: Yes. These will be given to you right after the general rehearsal.

patterns: If I am expecting to graduate in the first semester or summer term, when is the approximate time of my commencement ceremonies?
responses: You will graduate with first Semester/summer Term commencement ceremonies, if there is a schedule.

patterns: May I delay my participation and join the second semester commencement ceremonies?
Delay participation and join second semester commencement ceremony
Can I delay my commencement ceremony?
responses: No. You may only participate in your scheduled term of commencement ceremonies.

patterns: Who can request for a transcript of records (Transcript of Records)?
Can I request for my transcript of records?
Can I request for my Transcript of Records?
Can I view my Transcript of Records?
Can I ask my Transcript of Records?
Can I see my Transcript of Records?
Can I get my Transcript of Records?
Who can request for a TOR (TOR)?
Can I request for my TOR?
Can I request for my TOR?
Where can I get my TOR?
responses: Any current or former student at De La Salle University-Dasmariñas can request for  TOR through the Office of the Registrar Counter 1.

patterns: Can I get an electronic version of my Transcript of Records?
Can I view an electronic version of my Transcript of Records?
Can I see an electronic version of my Transcript of Records?
Is there a digital Transcript of Records?
responses: No. Electronic Transcript of Recordss are not available.

patterns: Can I get an unofficial version of my Transcript of Records?
Can I view an unofficial version of my Transcript of Records?
Can I see an unofficial version of my Transcript of Records?
responses: No. But you can view all of your grades online using the Student Portal.

patterns: How many Transcript of Records can I request?
Is there a limit to Transcript of Records requests?
responses: There is no limit.

patterns: How long will you hold my Transcript of Records until I or my authorized representative claims it?
Schedule to get Transcript of Records
responses: Six months from the scheduled release date.

patterns: Can I request for Transcript of Records if there is a financial hold on my account?
Can I see my Transript of Records while my account is on hold?
Can I view my Transript of Records while my account is on hold?
Can I get my Transript of Records while my account is on hold?
responses: No. You must settle your financial obligation to the University before we can release your Transcript of Records.

patterns: How do I get my diploma?
I want to get my diploma
responses: You must be cleared of all accountabilities from the University before you can get your diploma. Get a clearance form at the Office of the Registrar Counter 2.

patterns: I lost my original diploma, can I request for another copy?
Lost diploma. Can I get another copy?
Can I get another copy of my diploma?
responses: Yes. Submit an affidavit of loss to the Office of the Registrar Counter 1.

patterns: How can my parents access my records online?
is there any way for my parents to get my records online?
can my folks access my records online?
how can my parents have online access to my records?
ways for my parents to get my reocrds online
responses: Through the Parent Portal. To access, your parent must have an active account, which can be acquired from the Information Technology and Communications Center (ICTC).

patterns: How can I get data from the Office of the Registrar for my school project (or thesis)?
We want to ask the Registrar for data for our thesis
responses: Submit a Request for Data form at the Office of the Registrar Counter 1. It has to be signed by your class adviser, department head, and college dean.

patterns: What will I do if I already submitted the grades online, but, need to change the grade of a student?
What to do if I want to change grades
already passsed the grade online but need to change grade
what to do if I submitted my grade but need to change them?
how to change my grades if i already submitted my grades online?
I already gave my grades online but I need to change them how do i do that?
passed grades online but need to change,how
what to do if I passed my grades online but need to change them?
responses: You must submit a Change of Grade form at the Office of the Registrar.

patterns: I failed to encode the grades of my students online by the deadline for submission of grades, what I will do?
What will I do if I did not encode my students grades online?
I forgot to encode my grades of my students online
responses: Use the Special Report of Grades form to physically submit the grades of your students at the Office of the Registrar.

patterns: One or more students attend my class, but their names are not in my class list, what will I do?
A student attends but not in class list
A student attends not in list
A student is not in the list
responses: You must not allow them to continue attending your class.

patterns: Where do I go to pay my balance
responses: All transactions are to be made in the accounting office

patterns: When is the accounting office open?
responses: The Accounting Office's operating hours are from 8am to 5pm, from Mondays to Saturdays.
